Enhance the study group management system on the platform so that administrator members can easily edit, add, and remove study groups.

**Tasks:**

- [ ] Implement functionality allowing administrators to add new study groups to the platform.
- [ ] Provide an option for administrators to remove study groups that have ended within the community.
- [ ] Remove the option ‚ùå Connect your ETH wallet

- [ ] Notify administrators about the new functionalities and provide a guide if necessary.

Develop integration tests for the Build registration process when the cohort ends, specifically focusing on the NFT minting process. This test involves validating the integration between pubsub and cloud functions to ensure the NFT is correctly minted.

**Tasks:**
- [ ] Set up a test environment to simulate the end of a cohort.
- [ ] Create integration tests to verify that the pubsub triggers the correct cloud functions for minting the NFT.
- [ ] Validate that the cloud function executes the minting process without errors.
- [ ] Ensure the NFT minting process includes all required metadata and follows the expected format.
- [ ] Test the entire integration flow from cohort completion to successful NFT minting.
- [ ] Document the testing process and include instructions for running the integration tests.
- [ ] Address any issues or bugs found during the testing process.
- [ ] Review the integration tests with the team to ensure accuracy and completeness.

ISm2zd01ykbt9DwNVkxS.title: Inspect WalletConnect Kits
ISm2zd01ykbt9DwNVkxS.body:
#### Objective
Assess the ease of accessing contact information for users who log in with social accounts and determine if users can access the private key of the auto-generated account using the Connect Wallet App Kit plugin.

#### Scope
1. **Access to Contact Information:**
   - Investigate how the plugin handles login via social accounts.
   - Evaluate the process and ease of accessing user contact information (e.g., email, name) after login.

2. **Private Key Access:**
   - Determine if the plugin allows users to access the private key of their auto-generated account.
   - Assess the security implications and user experience related to accessing the private key.

#### Deliverables
1. **Testing and Evaluation:**
   - Implement a test setup to evaluate the plugin's functionalities.
   - Document or share the steps and outcomes of accessing contact information and private keys.

2. **Report:**
   - Provide a report on the ease of accessing user contact information.
   - Outline the method for users to access their private keys and any associated security concerns.

### Conclusion
This task aims to evaluate the Connect Wallet App Kit plugin's capabilities regarding social login contact information access and private key management to ensure it meets our requirements and security standards.

SSrS3AZTW5mlZAE7jBAT.title: Replace Thirdweb for WalletConnect
SSrS3AZTW5mlZAE7jBAT.body:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e99675f2-1693-425b-a9f1-4cbb1bb03ec9)

We are currently using MetaMask as the sole wallet option for connecting via ThirdWeb, which introduces unnecessary complexity for a simple task like retrieving a user's address to mint an NFT. This approach limits our flexibility and adds a heavy dependency on MetaMask and ThirdWeb.

We should replace MetaMask with WalletConnect directly, which will enable us to support a wider range of wallets, including those in ecosystems like Solana and Polkadot. This change will not only simplify the user experience but also broaden the scope of wallet compatibility for our platform.

This functionality should not be limited to tasks alone but should also extend to other content types on the platform, such as study groups and builds.

WS35pDfZuyUFIgKdkoCO.title: Generate short description using GPT Api
WS35pDfZuyUFIgKdkoCO.body:
Enhance the `fetchAndStoreIssues` function by integrating the GPT API to automatically generate short descriptions for tasks. The function should:

1. **API Integration:**
   - During the execution of `fetchAndStoreIssues`, call the OpenAI endpoint.
   - Pass the task description along with a prompt to generate a concise "short description" that captures essential details in a single phrase.

2. **Database Update:**
   - Store the generated short description in the "task" collection.
   - Ensure the `seed-data.json` is updated to reflect this new data structure.

3. **Testing:**
   - Test the implementation using the emulator.
   - Verify that short descriptions are accurately generated and stored in the "task" collection.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] The `fetchAndStoreIssues` function successfully integrates with the GPT API.
- [ ] Short descriptions are generated and stored in the "task" collection without losing key information.
- [ ] `seed-data.json` is updated accordingly.
- [ ] All functionalities are tested and verified in the emulator.

X5dTl37jnn5hmpj2jxzn.title: Fetch User Analytics for Repository Interactions
X5dTl37jnn5hmpj2jxzn.body:
#### Objective
Develop a cloud function to fetch user interaction data from our repositories using GraphQL APIs and generate the report.

#### Scope
1. **Data Collection:**
   - Fetch interaction data (forks, pull requests, commits, comments) from repositories using GraphQL APIs.
   - Ensure secure handling of authentication tokens.

2. **Report Generation:**
   - Analyze the fetched data and generate a report ranking users based on their interactions.

eN79Wi8aIuhnZybyDQKX.title: Fix Github Apply Button
eN79Wi8aIuhnZybyDQKX.body:
**Issue 1: Button Color**
- **Bug:** The "Apply" button remains red, indicating insufficient context, even if the user has the required context level.
- **Expected Behavior:** The "Apply" button should change color (to green or another appropriate color) once the user meets the necessary context level.

**Issue 2: GitHub Session Switching**
- **Bug:** When connecting a GitHub account, the user session changes to the email linked with GitHub. For example:
   - If my GitHub email is `yan@nomadbitcoin.xyz` and my login email on the platform is `yan@teste.com`, after connecting GitHub, my session changes to `yan@nomadbitcoin.xyz`.
- **Expected Behavior:** The session should remain associated with the original platform login (`yan@teste.com`) and should not switch to the GitHub email.
- **Root Cause:** The current implementation uses `loginGithub`, which initiates a login instead of simply connecting GitHub. It should be refactored to avoid altering the session.

qp0sax2MC6m5lDsUTzOy.title: Move email templates from platform and use Mailchimp templates
qp0sax2MC6m5lDsUTzOy.body:
Currently, our platform sends event-based emails (e.g., course registration, live session notifications) using hardcoded templates with dynamic parameters via Mandrill and JavaScript. To improve email management, we need to:

1. **Create and design email templates directly in Mailchimp.**
2. **Use Mailchimp‚Äôs API to trigger these emails based on platform events.**

### Tasks:
- [ ] Create email templates in Mailchimp for all necessary notifications.
- [ ] Store and use the Mailchimp Template IDs.
- [ ] Update API calls to Mandrill in the platform to trigger these templates.
- [ ] Pass dynamic parameters (e.g., user name, course details) to the Mailchimp API.

rOhypNTuHCQpeCbdiWDg.title: Build Youtube Courses Layout Prototype
rOhypNTuHCQpeCbdiWDg.body:
We need to enhance our course management system by implementing several new features, including course creation based on YouTube videos, improved metadata handling, and the development of course-related pages and support functionalities.

### Tasks:

- **Content and Metadata Handling:**
  - [ ] Read Markdown for Content.
    - [ ] Investigate whether we can also read metadata from markdown to leverage github to adding new content.
  - [ ] Create an easy way to generate Metadata for each new course.

- **Course Creation and Management:**
  - [ ] Create an agent that generates courses based on YouTube videos.
  - [ ] Export the course as Markdown.
  - [ ] Save this Markdown in the appropriate repository.
  - [ ] Create the course listing page.
  - [ ] Fetch all courses and populate filters, list courses.
  - [ ] Create a course page with modules and a final test.

- **Support and Engagement:**
  - [ ] Add a support chat button; send language parameter and connect with video transcripts and external resources to assist users.
  - [ ] Provide options to invite users to events or offer exclusive support.

- **Assignment Event Page:**
  - [ ] Develop a page for managing assignment events.

### Expected Outcome:
A fully functional course creation workflow that leverages YouTube content, streamlined metadata handling, and robust support and engagement features, enhancing both the user and admin experience.

wzILfic231c5EnOaO00O.body:
We are considering leveraging the OnlyDust interface to bootstrap our functionality, with some necessary adaptations. We only have a sketch by now, so the next step is to build it on Figma and apply the web3dev brand colors and styles to the existing screens.

* [Figma Section of OnlyDust -> Web3Task Interface](https://www.figma.com/board/27S5enxUJePGwjADVJ6rNT/WEB3TASK-v2-Roadmap?node-id=292-143&t=mCvfaS80UfQqfxPt-4)
* [WEB3DEV Brandig Book](https://www.figma.com/design/MP1W4qEhzLAyOrd1QZTiZH/Brand-Book-v1?node-id=0-1&t=iXfpUR6AZhmD8fXT-1)

**Deliverables:**

1. **Build on Figma**
   - [ ] Create Figma designs based on the initial sketch.

2. **Apply Brand Colors**
   - [ ] Update all screens with the primary, secondary, and accent colors from the brand guidelines.

3. **Update Typography**
   - [ ] Apply brand-specific fonts to headings, body text, and other text elements following brand‚Äôs design guidelines.

4. **Style Components**
   - [ ] Ensure all UI components (buttons, inputs, cards, modals, tables, etc.) follow the brand's look and feel.

5. **Responsive Design**
   - [ ] Verify and adjust the design to ensure it looks good on different screen sizes and devices.

6. **Additional Figma Tasks**
   - [ ] Create a prototype with interactive elements to demonstrate the flow and user interactions.
   - [ ] Document any deviations from the initial mockup and provide reasoning for changes.

y9hC2sWcuy1ld5RSK5Wh.title: Remove super-admin access for members who are not part of the organization
y9hC2sWcuy1ld5RSK5Wh.body:
## Description:

Review and remove admin access for members who are no longer part of the organization to maintain security and ensure proper access control.

- [ ] [Identify all members with super-admin access across platforms](https://pt.w3d.community/admin/member_manager/users?utf8=%E2%9C%93&roles%5B%5D=Admin&roles%5B%5D=Tech+Admin&roles%5B%5D=Super+Admin&roles%5B%5D=Resource+Admin%3A+Article&roles%5B%5D=Resource+Admin%3A+Badge&roles%5B%5D=Resource+Admin%3A+BadgeAchievement&joining_start=&joining_end=&date_format=DD%2FMM%2FYYYY).
- [ ] Cross-check the list of super-admins with current active members of the organization.
- [ ] Remove super-admin access for members who are no longer part of the organization.
- [ ] Notify relevant stakeholders of the changes.
- [ ] Document the process and update internal access control policies.

> [!NOTE]  
> @annabida  doesn't have permission to edit access even though I'm super admin
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/97b8a153-e84b-47a3-8c7a-ccd99e2ff984)

The members who are no longer part of the organization and are with super-admin are:
* @caiovmatos 
* @allluz
